review: If I could give this another 5 stars I would! We have an expensive cable plan and we barely use any of the channels. with this little guy we are streaming the Netflix and a lot of our 'On Demand' channels We are contemplating dropping the big cable package and just going with the ROKU Streaming. I was tasked with finding a way to do the Netflix streaming. We were tired of waiting for the discs and missing out on great shows just because they aren't available on discs. I started my sears with Amazon TV Fire stick and then quickly found the ROKU line of products. They were inexpensive so I thought I found the wrong thing. Nope They are exactly what we needed. and $45 (the Streaming Stick was $40 and the little USB power cord was $5) and a week later I was watching this Netflix's Bloodline! (Great show! BTW)  During set up it offered a wide variety of other channels and options for various programs. We have not explored all of that yet but I am so happy to of found such an inexpensive way of streaming. Life Is Good Today!

review: We love the apps, quick jump buttons, and all that.... It has been great, until about 5 months ago when we needed to start unplugging it to make it reset. It wasn't a big deal at first. But about 2 weeks ago, we started to have to do it almost every day. Today, it is now cutting out and the HDMI port keeps losing the signal. It is cutting out and the screen will go rainbow static, then white lines, then show, then .... well you get it. It has also stopped modulating the sound properly where as before there were no problems with quiet/loud.  I was hoping for a bit more longevity than 15 months. I don't think that is asking for too much. I don't know if we will replace with another Roku....
